scenes.plot_segment: Meredith Grey narrates about the competitive nature of surgical residency, reflecting on how some people are suited for “the game” and others are not. She acknowledges her mother, Ellis Grey, as one of the greatest surgeons, but admits feeling unprepared and overwhelmed as she begins her first day as a surgical intern at Seattle Grace Hospital.

Meredith Grey wakes up in her mother’s house after a one-night stand with Derek Shepherd, whom she met at a bar the previous night. Embarrassed and anxious about being late for her first day as a surgical intern at Seattle Grace Hospital, Meredith hurriedly gets dressed and tells Derek he needs to leave before she returns from her shower. Their conversation is awkward, with Meredith avoiding personal questions and revealing that the house belonged to her mother, Ellis Grey, and is being sold. Before parting, Meredith and Derek exchange names for the first time, agreeing not to pretend to care or share details about themselves. Derek leaves as Meredith prepares for her first shift.

Meredith Grey joins a group of new surgical interns—Cristina Yang, Izzie Stevens, and George O'Malley—as they gather for orientation at Seattle Grace Hospital. Dr. Richard Webber addresses them, emphasizing that just a month ago they were medical students, but now they are doctors facing seven years of demanding surgical residency. He warns that many will not make it through the program. Meredith, feeling anxious and unprepared, internally repeats that they are “screwed” as she takes in the gravity of the moment.

Meredith Grey, Cristina Yang, Izzie Stevens, and George O'Malley gather in a hospital hallway as they wait for their assignments on their first day as surgical interns at Seattle Grace Hospital. The group exchanges introductions, with George nervously referencing meeting Cristina at a mixer and trying to make conversation. Cristina and Izzie discuss rumors about one of the interns being a model and speculate about their supervising resident, Dr. Miranda Bailey, who is known as “the Nazi” for her strict reputation. The interns are called out by name and assigned to Dr. Bailey, who immediately asserts her authority and prepares to lay out her expectations for the group.

Dr. Miranda Bailey gathers the new surgical interns—Meredith Grey, Cristina Yang, Izzie Stevens, and George O'Malley—in the hallway and establishes her authority by laying out five strict rules they must follow: no sucking up, answer every page at a run, never wake her unless a patient is dying, don’t let the patient be dead when she arrives, and always move when she moves. Bailey assigns tasks to each intern: Cristina is responsible for lab work, George for patient workups, Meredith for overseeing Katie Bryce, a teenage patient with seizures, and Izzie for performing rectal exams. Bailey emphasizes the seriousness of their responsibilities and warns them that she expects complete adherence to her rules, making it clear that their performance will determine their future in the program.

Meredith Grey and her fellow interns, Cristina Yang, Izzie Stevens, and George O’Malley, rush to respond to a medical emergency as Dr. Miranda Bailey leads them in treating Katie Bryce, a 15-year-old patient experiencing severe seizures. Dr. Bailey issues rapid, precise instructions, assigning tasks to each intern while maintaining strict control of the situation. Dr. Preston Burke enters and gives additional orders, emphasizing the urgency. Meredith is tasked with monitoring Katie’s vitals, Cristina assists with medication, and George and Izzie help stabilize the patient. The interns, still new and anxious on their first shift, work together under Bailey and Burke’s supervision to bring Katie’s seizures under control and prepare her for further tests.

Meredith Grey approaches Dr. Miranda Bailey in the hospital corridor to report that Katie Bryce’s lab results are clear. Meredith mentions hearing a rumor that the intern who performs best on the first shift will get to scrub in on a procedure. Dr. Bailey, unimpressed by Meredith’s attempt to engage, curtly tells her to leave and get back to work.

In a patient room, George O'Malley, nervous but trying to be reassuring, speaks with Mr. Savage, who is awaiting bypass surgery. Mr. Savage jokes about missing bacon after the operation, and George earnestly expresses his wish to help, though he acknowledges his role as a healer rather than a miracle worker. Sensing George’s uncertainty, Mr. Savage tells him he seems lost and asks how George feels about being a doctor. Mr. Savage laments missing his daughter’s pageant and shares that her talent is rhythmic gymnastics. As their conversation ends, George prepares to perform a rectal exam, awkwardly explaining the procedure to Mr. Savage.

In the break room, George O'Malley, Cristina Yang, and Izzie Stevens commiserate about their exhausting first shift as surgical interns. George complains about having to perform seventeen rectal exams and worries that Dr. Miranda Bailey dislikes him. The conversation shifts to Meredith Grey, with Cristina and Izzie gossiping about her mother, Ellis Grey, a legendary surgeon whose reputation looms over Meredith. They express envy and discuss the pressure Meredith must feel to live up to her mother’s legacy. Izzie vents about a difficult patient, Katie Bryce, who is experiencing unexplained seizures and is assigned to Meredith. The group bonds over their shared anxieties and the intimidating expectations placed on them as new interns.

Dr. Miranda Bailey gathers Meredith Grey, Cristina Yang, Izzie Stevens, and George O'Malley, announcing that George has been selected to scrub in for an appendectomy—a privilege typically reserved for the most promising intern. George is visibly shocked and receives congratulations from his peers, while Cristina expresses skepticism about his abilities. Nearby, Dr. Preston Burke and Dr. Bailey discuss George’s selection, with Burke suggesting that George was chosen to be “terrorized” as an example for the others. Meanwhile, Katie Bryce’s parents arrive at the nurses’ station, anxiously questioning Meredith and Izzie about their daughter’s worsening condition and voicing frustration over the lack of clear answers.

Meredith Grey approaches Dr. Derek Shepherd to discuss the case of Katie Bryce, the teenage patient experiencing unexplained seizures. As they begin talking, both Meredith and Derek feel the tension from their one-night stand the previous night, now complicated by their new professional roles—Derek as Meredith’s attending and Meredith as his intern. Meredith firmly states that their personal history cannot continue, emphasizing the need for strict boundaries in the hospital. Derek attempts to ease the awkwardness with light humor, but Meredith remains resolute, insisting that their relationship must be strictly professional while they work together on Katie’s case.

In the operating gallery, Meredith Grey, Cristina Yang, and Izzie Stevens join several other interns as they watch George O'Malley perform an appendectomy on his first day under the supervision of Dr. Miranda Bailey and Dr. Preston Burke. Cristina, skeptical of George’s abilities, leads the interns in placing bets on whether he will succeed or fail. As George begins the surgery, he appears steady and follows Dr. Bailey’s instructions, but the pressure mounts with the eyes of his peers on him. Midway through the procedure, George hesitates and accidentally causes internal bleeding, prompting Dr. Burke to step in and take over the operation. Dr. Bailey instructs George to step away from the table, and he leaves the OR visibly shaken. In the gallery, Cristina and the other interns quietly dub George “007,” joking that he now has a “license to kill.”

In the hallway at Seattle Grace Hospital, George O'Malley confronts Cristina Yang and Izzie Stevens about being called “007” after his mistake in surgery. Cristina and Izzie deny using the nickname, but George remains suspicious and self-conscious. As the tension lingers, a hospital-wide emergency page is announced for Katie Bryce, the teenage patient with seizures. Meredith Grey, Cristina, Izzie, and George immediately rush off together in response to the page, leaving their conversation unresolved as they hurry to Katie’s room.

Meredith Grey enters Katie Bryce’s hospital room to respond to a page. Katie, bored and frustrated about missing her pageant on television, admits she paged Meredith just for company. Meredith, already exhausted and overwhelmed by her first day, is irritated by Katie’s behavior and tells her to go to sleep and stop paging unless it’s an emergency, emphasizing that she doesn’t have time for games.

In a busy corridor of Seattle Grace Hospital, Izzie Stevens approaches Dr. Miranda Bailey to ask for help starting a central line on a patient with difficult veins. Dr. Bailey, focused on her work and reinforcing her earlier rules, curtly reminds Izzie not to disturb her unless the patient is dying. Izzie hesitates, clearly anxious and uncertain, but Bailey remains firm, emphasizing the importance of the interns handling routine procedures on their own and only escalating emergencies. Izzie reluctantly returns to her patient, left to manage the challenging procedure without Bailey’s assistance.

Cristina Yang reviews a post-operative patient’s chart and suggests pneumonia as the cause of the patient’s fever, but Nurse Olivia challenges her diagnosis, prompting Cristina to defensively list the five common causes of post-op fever. Olivia recommends considering a pulmonary embolus, which Cristina acknowledges after further discussion. Alex Karev, another intern, arrives and introduces himself with a dismissive attitude toward nurses, making a derogatory remark that irritates Olivia. The interns—Cristina, Meredith Grey, Izzie Stevens, George O'Malley, and Alex—briefly discuss Katie Bryce’s mysterious case and the competitive dynamics among the new surgical interns.

Katie Bryce suddenly suffers another violent seizure in her hospital bed. Meredith Grey, Cristina Yang, Izzie Stevens, and George O’Malley rush to her side as Dr. Miranda Bailey arrives to take charge. The interns quickly administer anti-seizure medications and attempt to stabilize Katie, but her condition rapidly deteriorates. Meredith calls for Dr. Derek Shepherd, but before he arrives, Katie’s heart stops. Under Bailey’s direction, the team immediately begins resuscitation efforts, with George preparing the defibrillator and Cristina managing the airway. After several tense moments and multiple shocks, Katie’s heart rhythm is restored. Dr. Bailey sternly reprimands the interns for not paging her the instant Katie’s condition worsened, emphasizing the seriousness of their responsibilities and the importance of following her rules. The team stands shaken but relieved as Katie is stabilized, realizing the gravity of their roles as surgical interns.

Katie Bryce’s parents, Mr. and Mrs. Bryce, confront Dr. Derek Shepherd about the lack of a diagnosis for their daughter’s worsening seizures. Mr. Bryce grows frustrated and demands a different doctor, while Mrs. Bryce anxiously seeks reassurance. Dr. Shepherd admits he does not yet have answers but promises to keep searching for the cause. In another room, Dr. Preston Burke explains the need for bypass surgery to Tony Savage and his wife, Gloria. Dr. Burke reassures Tony about the procedure, and George O’Malley, the intern assisting, tries to comfort Gloria by promising that Tony will be fine.

In the intern break room, Meredith Grey practices suturing by stitching a banana, while Cristina Yang teases her about smiling at George O'Malley, who has just earned the nickname “007” after his surgical mishap. Meredith, Cristina, Izzie Stevens, and George discuss the pressures of their first day and speculate about why Dr. Miranda Bailey has called them together. Dr. Derek Shepherd enters, asking the interns to help diagnose Katie Bryce’s mysterious seizures, promising that whoever finds the answer will get to scrub in on her surgery. Dr. Bailey hands out Katie’s chart, and the interns eagerly begin reviewing her case, determined to prove themselves.

An intern pages Dr. Miranda Bailey about a post-operative patient who is still short of breath. Dr. Bailey, busy and unimpressed, dismisses the intern’s concern, attributing the symptoms to the patient’s advanced age and instructing the intern not to page her again unless the patient is dying. Meanwhile, Meredith Grey and Cristina Yang meet in the hallway and agree to collaborate on solving Katie Bryce’s case, deciding to split the reward of scrubbing in on surgery if they succeed. As they discuss possible diagnoses, Cristina asks Meredith why she turned down the chance to scrub in if they solve the case. After some hesitation, Meredith confides that she slept with Dr. Derek Shepherd, which complicates her feelings about working with him. The two continue brainstorming, determined to find the cause of Katie’s seizures.

Cristina Yang and Meredith Grey sit together, poring over Katie Bryce’s case and debating possible causes for her persistent seizures. As they review Katie’s history, Meredith suddenly recalls that Katie suffered a minor fall during rhythmic gymnastics practice. Meredith connects the dots, realizing the fall could have caused a rare subarachnoid hemorrhage. Excited, Meredith and Cristina rush to find Dr. Derek Shepherd and present their theory. Dr. Shepherd reviews Katie’s scans and confirms their suspicion of a brain aneurysm. Impressed by their diagnostic work, Dr. Shepherd tells Meredith she has earned the right to scrub in on Katie’s surgery, emphasizing that it’s because of her medical insight, not their personal connection.

Cristina Yang confronts Meredith Grey in the hospital hallway after learning that Meredith was chosen to scrub in on Katie Bryce’s surgery. Frustrated and hurt, Cristina accuses Meredith of receiving special treatment because of her mother, Ellis Grey, and her connection to Dr. Derek Shepherd. Meredith insists she was selected based on her work on Katie’s case, but Cristina remains skeptical, pointing out the unfairness of the situation and questioning whether Meredith truly earned the opportunity. Meredith tries to apologize and explain herself, but Cristina, feeling betrayed, tells Meredith to accept the consequences of her actions and walks away, leaving their friendship strained.

George O'Malley approaches Gloria Savage in the hospital waiting area and gently informs her that her husband, Mr. Savage, did not survive the heart surgery due to extensive cardiac damage. Gloria is overcome with grief, breaking down as she processes the news. George is visibly shaken and emotional after delivering the message, struggling with the weight of his responsibility as an intern.

In Katie Bryce’s hospital room, Meredith Grey helps prepare Katie for her upcoming brain surgery, gently reassuring her and making sure she feels comfortable. As Meredith adjusts Katie’s hair, Dr. Derek Shepherd enters and tells Katie he’ll see her soon in the OR. After Katie is wheeled out, Meredith quietly asks Derek if she was chosen to scrub in on the surgery because they slept together. Derek teases her, but then sincerely tells Meredith she earned the spot through her hard work diagnosing Katie’s condition. When Meredith hesitates and suggests Cristina Yang should scrub in instead, Derek encourages her to take the opportunity, insisting she deserves it. Meredith, still conflicted but grateful, agrees to participate in the surgery.

George O'Malley sits with Meredith Grey in a quiet moment after their exhausting first shift as surgical interns. George confides in Meredith about his insecurities, admitting that his parents are proud of him but that he doubts his own abilities as a surgeon. He recalls how his mother once tried to talk him out of pursuing medicine, fearing it would be too hard for him. Meredith listens and reassures him, sharing her own anxieties about living up to her mother Ellis Grey’s reputation. The two bond over their shared doubts and relief at having survived their first day, finding comfort in each other's company as they face the challenges ahead.

Dr. Richard Webber quizzes the new surgical interns about a patient who has developed a fever after surgery. George O'Malley struggles to answer, unable to recall the causes. Cristina Yang steps in and confidently lists the five common causes of post-operative fever: wind (atelectasis), water (urinary tract infection), wound (surgical site infection), walking (deep vein thrombosis), and wonder drugs (drug fever). Dr. Webber commends Cristina for her thorough answer and instructs the team to follow the appropriate diagnostic steps. He then recognizes Meredith Grey as Ellis Grey’s daughter, welcoming her to Seattle Grace Hospital and acknowledging her mother’s legacy.

Dr. Derek Shepherd gathers Meredith Grey, Cristina Yang, Izzie Stevens, and George O'Malley in the operating room to perform surgery on Katie Bryce, the teenage gymnast suffering from seizures. As the team prepares, Derek announces, “It’s a beautiful night to save lives,” and invites Meredith to scrub in, acknowledging her and Cristina’s work in diagnosing Katie’s rare subarachnoid hemorrhage. Meredith narrates about the overwhelming challenges and doubts that come with being a surgeon, reflecting on the reasons people might quit but also on the exhilaration and fulfillment she finds in the work. The surgery proceeds smoothly, with the team working together under Derek’s guidance. When the operation is successful, relief and pride ripple through the group, and the interns share a quiet moment of celebration, buoyed by their first real victory in the operating room.

Meredith Grey and Cristina Yang, exhausted after their first grueling shift as surgical interns, sit together and share a candid, lighthearted exchange. They agree not to get emotional about the day’s events, joking about their disheveled appearance and fatigue. Their brief conversation underscores their growing friendship and mutual understanding as they navigate the challenges of residency.

Meredith Grey and Derek Shepherd meet in the hallway after Katie Bryce’s surgery. Meredith, still wearing her scrubs, describes to Derek the rush and exhilaration she felt performing surgery for the first time, admitting she was terrified but loved every minute of it. Derek listens with quiet encouragement, telling Meredith she did well and earned her place in the operating room. There is a brief, charged pause as they acknowledge the complicated connection between them, both aware of their personal history and new professional dynamic. After sharing this moment of vulnerability and accomplishment, Meredith and Derek part ways, each returning to their responsibilities at the hospital.

Meredith Grey narrates about surviving her first shift as a surgical intern, reflecting on the challenges she and her fellow interns—Cristina Yang, Izzie Stevens, and George O'Malley—faced. Feeling the weight of her mother's legacy, Meredith decides not to sell Ellis Grey’s house and instead plans to keep it, hoping to find roommates among the other interns. Later, Meredith visits Ellis Grey at her care facility; Ellis, suffering from Alzheimer’s disease, does not recognize Meredith. Meredith gently reminds her mother that she was a surgeon, acknowledging both Ellis’s legacy and the distance between them.
